ows:ServiceIdentification.ows:Title: EMODnet Seabed Habitats Map Library WFS Service
ows:ServiceIdentification.ows:Abstract:
WFS end-point for individual habitat maps and models held by EMODnet Seabed Habitats.
Includes all data with access limitations of "View and Download" (excluding "View only" data)

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:nl000065
FeatureType.Title: Presence of Mussel areas in the Dutch wadden Sea
FeatureType.Abstract: Compiled information about the presence of mussel beds in mussel areas in the period of 1966 untill 1997. The data is split up in two groups: 1-6 times(years) observed and 7-17 times.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:bg003002
FeatureType.Title: [BG003002] Benthic biotopes in Ropotamo SAC
FeatureType.Abstract: Map of benthic biotopes in the sediments in part of Natura 2000 SAC Ropotamo, the Bulgarian Black Sea. The biotopes were defined based on the sediment type, depth range and the typical associated macrozoobenthos communities as differentiated by multivariate similarity analyses.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:bg003003
FeatureType.Title: [BG003003] Folk 5 substrate map of Bulgarian Black Sea shelf
FeatureType.Abstract: Map of surface sediments in the Bulgarian Black Sea shelf classified according Folk 5-coarse sediment, mixed sediment , sand and mud , muddy sand, rocks

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:bg003004
FeatureType.Title: [BG003004] Folk 7 substrate map of Bulgarian Black Sea Shelf
FeatureType.Abstract: Map of surface sediments in the Bulgarian Black Sea shelf classified according Folk 7-coarse sediment, mixed sediment , sand , sandy mud,mud, muddy sand,rocks

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:bg003005
FeatureType.Title: [BG003005] Broad habitat types in Bulgarian Black Sea shelf
FeatureType.Abstract: Map of broad habitat types in Bulgarian Black Sea shelf which equate to one or more habitat types of the EUNIS classification

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:bg004001
FeatureType.Title: [BG004001] BG004001
FeatureType.Abstract: Soft bottom sandy 1110 habitats within the BB0000146 'Gradina-Zlatna ribka' SCI area. Mapped and created by IBER-BAS within the BalkanMed RECONNECT project ( 2017-2020)

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:bg004002
FeatureType.Title: [BG004002] BG004002
FeatureType.Abstract: BG0000146 Habitat type 1170 rocky reefs and EUNIS infra- and circalittoral habitats mapcreated by IBER-BAS within the Balkanmed-RECONNECTproject (2017-2020). EUNIS-2019 level 3 and 4 classification scheme was applied.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:bg004003
FeatureType.Title: [BG004003] BG004003
FeatureType.Abstract: Zostera spp. seagrass beds within the BG0000146 SCI area 'Gradina-Zlatna Ribka' , mapped during the Balkanmed- RECONNECT project by IBER-BAS (2017-2020). Acoustic data and satellite images were groundtruthed by georeferenced scuba diving studies and sampling.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:de004001
FeatureType.Title: [DE004001] Suspected areas of occurrence of the marine FFH habitat types in the coastal waters of Mecklenburg-Vorpommern
FeatureType.Abstract: The data is not based on targeted mapping of the areas of marine habitat types. Therefore, different data sources were collected, evaluated and interpreted

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:de004002
FeatureType.Title: [DE004002] Occurrences of habitat types according to Annex I Habitat Directive
FeatureType.Abstract: Known occurrences of habitat types 1110, 1130, 1140, 1150, 1160 and 1170 according to Annex I Habitats Directive

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:dk003001
FeatureType.Title: [DK003001] DK003001_HabitatsDirective_DEF
FeatureType.Abstract: The substrate and nature type mapping was, as for the research for potential areas with raw materials, carried out for the Danish Nature Agency in the summer 2010. The survey area was about 5.000 km2 in the central and western part of the Danish part of the North Sea (Phase 1 and 2). The aim of the project was to collect basic information of the seabed characteristics and biological parameters, and thereby to provide information about nature types, to be used in the implementation of the EU Directive

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:dk003002
FeatureType.Title: [DK003002] DK003002_HabitatsDirective_DEF
FeatureType.Abstract: The Ministry of the Environment requested in 2011 the Consortium GEUS and Orbicon to carry out mapping tasks in the Danish part of the Kattegat and Western Baltic, partly as part of the government's raw material mapping and partly in connection with the implementation of the Marine Strategy Directive.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:dk003003
FeatureType.Title: [DK003003] DK003003_HabitatsDirective_DEF
FeatureType.Abstract: The Ministry of the Environment requested in 2011 the Consortium GEUS and Orbicon to carry out mapping tasks in the Danish part of the Kattegat and Western Baltic, partly as part of the government's raw material mapping and partly in connection with the implementation of the Marine Strategy Directive. This studyarea covers part of Kattegat.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:dk003061
FeatureType.Title: [DK003061] DK003061_HabitatsDirective_DEF
FeatureType.Abstract: The objective of the study is to provide more information about the seabed for use in substrate- and habitat classification. In the classification there have been used 2134 km of data with sonar, sediment echosounder and sidescan. Furthermore 4519 km seismic and acustic archive data from existing studies have been included in the analysis. The study area consist of Kattegat and the Belt Sea. This area is in Kattegat, Laesoe.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:es000001
FeatureType.Title: [ES000001] EUNIS L3 Benthic habitat map of the Basque Country (SPAIN) - ES000001
FeatureType.Abstract: Benthic habitat map of the Basque country coast (SPAIN), classified with EUNIS (European Natural Information System) classification up to level 3. Symbology uses the EUNIS level3 colour scheme proposed within the MESH Atlantic European project (http://www.meshatlantic.eu)

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:es001000
FeatureType.Title: [ES001000] Benthic communities in the Natural Reserve Isla del Trocadero, Cdiz
FeatureType.Abstract: Marine habitat map of the benthic communities in the Natural Reserve Isla del Trocadero, Cdiz (Spain).

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:es001001
FeatureType.Title: [ES001001] Types of Habitat EUNIS in Le Danois Bank
FeatureType.Abstract: Cartography associated with the Management of the AMP and ZEC in Le Danois Bank. Results of research works with multibeam bathymetry, ROVs, submarine photography, bottom reflectivity, seismic profiles and the granulometric and biological analyses of the samples gathered during the surveys.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:es001002
FeatureType.Title: [ES001002] Benthic communities in the north littoral of strait of Gibraltar
FeatureType.Abstract: Cartography of benthic communities to promoting adequate strategies for the use, management and conservation of littoral areas depending on the ecological value of the different benthic communities established and on the local geographical distribution.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:es001021
FeatureType.Title: [ES001021] Habitats LIC Banco de Galicia
FeatureType.Abstract: This dataset contains the main habitats maps from the SCI (Site of Community Importance) Banco de Galicia. The Galician Bank is a deep underwater mountain located at the northwest of the Iberian Peninsula, 180 km from the Galician coast (in the north-east Atlantic Ocean). Its summit is located at a depth of between 650 and 1,500 metres. Its steep slopes descend from the summit to the abyssal plains located 4,000 meters below sea level. This study was supported by the INDEMARES-LIFE+ Project, EC contract INDEMARES-LIFE+ (07/NAT/E/000732): Inventory and Designation of the Natura 2000 network in marine areas of the Spanish State (www.indemares.es/en). This work was coordinated by the Spanish Institute of Oceanography (IEO, www.ieo.es) and the Biodiversity Foundation (www.fundacion-biodiversidad.es). The interpretation has been made possible thanks to direct and indirect samplings and geophysical data from campaigns "ECOMARG09", "INDEMARES_BANGAL0810", "INDEMARES_BANGAL0711" and "RADPROF0912". Habitats are classified according to EUNIS nomenclature and the List of Marine Habitats in Spain (LPRE, that its classified hierarchically and was completed and published in March 2013).

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:es001022
FeatureType.Title: [ES001022] Habitats LIC Volcanes de fango del Golfo de Cdiz
FeatureType.Abstract: This dataset contains the habitats map from the SCI (Site of Community Importance) Volcanes de fango del Golfo de Cdiz. The Gulf of Cadiz is located in the eastern sector of the North Atlantic Ocean, to the southwest of the Iberian Peninsula. Mud Volcanoes are seafloor edifices, of a usually conical geometry, that result from the release of mud, hydrocarbon and fluids in gas-rich areas over pressured sediments. This study was supported by the INDEMARES-LIFE+ Project, EC contract INDEMARES-LIFE+ (07/NAT/E/000732): Inventory and Designation of the Natura 2000 network in marine areas of the Spanish State (www.indemares.es/en). This work was coordinated by the Spanish Institute of Oceanography (IEO, www.ieo.es) and the Biodiversity Foundation (www.fundacion-biodiversidad.es). The interpretation has been made possible thanks to direct and indirect samplings and geophysical data from campaigns INDEMARES_CHICA (CHICA0610, CHICA0211, CHICA1011 and CHICA0412). Habitats are classified according to EUNIS nomenclature and the List of Marine Habitats in Spain (LPRE, that its classified hierarchically and was completed and published in March 2013).

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:es001023
FeatureType.Title: [ES001023] Habitats LIC Sur de Almera - Seco de los Olivos
FeatureType.Abstract: This dataset contains the main habitats maps from the SCI (Site of Community Importance) Sur de Almera - Seco de los Olivos. Seco de los Olivos is a seamount situated in the Alboran Sea (western Mediterranean, southeast Iberian peninsula). This study was supported by the INDEMARES-LIFE+ Project, EC contract INDEMARES-LIFE+ (07/NAT/E/000732): Inventory and Designation of Marine Natura 2000 Network areas in the Spanish seas (www.indemares.es/en). This work was coordinated by the Spanish Institute of Oceanography (IEO, www.ieo.es) and the Biodiversity Foundation (www.fundacion-biodiversidad.es). The interpretation has been made possible thanks to direct and indirect samplings and geophysical data from campaigns OCEANA I-2010, OCEANA II-2011, OCEANA III-2012 and INDEMARES_SECO1012. Habitats are classified according to EUNIS nomenclature and the List of Marine Habitats in Spain (LPRE, that its classified hierarchically and was completed and published in March 2013).

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:es001024
FeatureType.Title: [ES001024] Habitat LIC Sistema de Caones Submarinos de Avils
FeatureType.Abstract: This dataset contains the habitats map from the SCI (Site of Community Importance) Sistema de caones submarinos de Avils (Avils Canyon System). The Avils Canyon system is located in the eastern sector of the North Atlantic Ocean, on the continental margin to the north of the Iberian Peninsula. It is structurally a highly complex area, where the continental shelf in the Bay of Biscay is deeply affected by the action of tectonic compression, containing important geomorphological elements; these include: three great submarine canyons, a marginal platform and a tall structural rocky mass. This study was supported by the INDEMARES-LIFE+ Project, EC contract INDEMARES-LIFE+ (07/NAT/E/000732): Inventory and Designation of the Natura 2000 network in marine areas of the Spanish State (www.indemares.es/en). This work was coordinated by the Spanish Institute of Oceanography (IEO, www.ieo.es) and the Biodiversity Foundation (www.fundacion-biodiversidad.es). The interpretation has been made possible thanks to direct and indirect samplings and geophysical data from campaigns INDEMARES (AVILES_0710, AVILES_0410, AVILES_0412-0912). Habitats are classified according to EUNIS nomenclature and the List of Marine Habitats in Spain (LPRE, that its classified hierarchically and was completed and published in March 2013).

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:es001025
FeatureType.Title: [ES001025] HABITATS LIC CANAL DE MENORCA
FeatureType.Abstract: This dataset contains the habitats map from the SCI (Site of Community Importance) Canal de Menorca. The "Menorca Channel" is a marine corridor located between the islands of Mallorca and Menorca in the Balearic Islands archipelago, with a minimum distance between the two islands of 36 kilometers. Its geographical position in the centre of the Western Mediterranean and its location, between islands, gives the area a peculiar set of oceanographic characteristics, including strong currentsand unusually transparent waters. This study was supported by the INDEMARES-LIFE+ Project, EC contract INDEMARES-LIFE+ (07/NAT/E/000732): Inventory and Designation of the Natura 2000 network in marine areas of the Spanish State (www.indemares.es/en). This work was coordinated by the Biodiversity Foundation (www.fundacion-biodiversidad.es). Habitats are classified according to EUNIS nomenclature and the List of Marine Habitats in Spain (LPRE, that its classified hierarchically and was completed and published in March 2013). Habitats classification are been simplified owing to the requirements of the EMODnet (European Marine Observation and Data Network ) portal for Seabed Habitats.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:es001026
FeatureType.Title: [ES001026] Habitats LIC Sistema de Caones Submarinos Occidentales del Golfo de Len
FeatureType.Abstract: This dataset contains the habitats map from the SCI (Site of Community Importance) Sistema de Caones Submarinos Occidentales del Golfo de Len. The marine area South-West Gulf of Lions canyons system is located in the northeastern part of the Iberian Peninsula. The coastline belongs to the Catalan province of Girona, featuring a large number of rocky outcrops with many coves, small beaches, vertical cliffs and islets. Cape Creus is the most notorious element of the landscape, which corresponds to the easternmost part of the Pyrenees Mountains. This small peninsula is characterized by its wildness, and despite its low relief it penetrates into the Mediterranean Sea for more than 10 kilometers.This study was supported by the INDEMARES-LIFE+ Project, EC contract INDEMARES-LIFE+ (07/NAT/E/000732): Inventory and Designation of the Natura 2000 network in marine areas of the Spanish State (www.indemares.es/en). This work was coordinated by the Biodiversity Foundation (www.fundacion-biodiversidad.es). Habitats are classified according to EUNIS nomenclature and the List of Marine Habitats in Spain (LPRE, that its classified hierarchically and was completed and published in March 2013). Habitats classification are been simplified owing to the requirements of the EMODnet (European Marine Observation and Data Network) portal for Seabed Habitats.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:es001027
FeatureType.Title: [ES001027] HABITATS LIC Espacio marino de Illes Columbretes
FeatureType.Abstract: This dataset contains the habitats map from the SCI (Site of Community Importance) Espacio marino de Illes Columbretes. The Columbretes Islands, a series of small islands, islets and submerged elevations of volcanic origin, are found in the Western Mediterranean at the northern limit of the Gulf of Valencia, 28 miles from the Gulf of Oropesa and just over 50 kilometers from the coast to the east of Castelln de la Plana. There are 24 islets gathered in 4 groups each named after its largest landmass. This volcanic field covers an area of 90 by 40 kilometers at a depth of 80 to 90 metres. The Illa Grossa and the other islands and islets are formed from basaltic materials or phonolitic rocks. These islands and the associated submerged volcanic field are one of the rare examples of Quaternary volcanism in the Mediterranean. This study was supported by the INDEMARES-LIFE+ Project, EC contract INDEMARES-LIFE+ (07/NAT/E/000732): Inventory and Designation of the Natura 2000 network in marine areas of the Spanish State (www.indemares.es/en). This work was coordinated by the Biodiversity Foundation (www.fundacion-biodiversidad.es). This study was made possible through the collaboration of multiple teams of researchers: Department of Ecology (University of Barcelona - UB), Center for Advanced Studies of Blanes (CEAB - CSIC), Institute of Marine Sciences (ICM - CSIC), Balearic Oceanography Centre (COB) - IEO (Spanish Institute of Oceanography) and Consolidate Research Group Marine Geosciences (GRC-GM) (University of Barcelona - UB). Habitats are classified according to EUNIS nomenclature and the List of Marine Habitats in Spain (LPRE, that its classified hierarchically and was completed and published in March 2013). Habitats classification are been simplified owing to the requirements of the EMODnet (European Marine Observation and Data Network) portal for Seabed Habitats.

FeatureType.Title: [ES003011] Marine communities of the coast of Fuerteventura

FeatureType.Abstract: Habitat map "ES003012" collated as part of the EMODnet Seabed Habitats initiative

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr000003
FeatureType.Title: [FR000003] Peuplements benthiques en Manche occidentale (zone prlittorale) (1968) au 1/180000
FeatureType.Abstract:
Cette cartographie a t ralise en 2010 daprs la carte gnrale de la Manche occidentale de la thse de Louis Cabioch (Station biologique de Roscoff) "Contribution la connaissance des peuplements benthiques de la Manche occidentale" publie en 1968, et complte pour la partie "Secteur Golo" par des donnes originales fournies par le mme auteur.
La carte au 1 / 180 000 de la thse a t numrise en 2003 et les donnes du secteur Golo en 2007, dans le cadre du Rseau de surveillance de la flore et de la faune benthique marine Rebent. Lharmonisation avec la typologie EUNIS a t effectue avec lexpertise de Frank Gentil.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr000004
FeatureType.Title: [FR000004] Rpartition des peuplements benthiques dans la rgion de Roscoff (1968) au 1/50000
FeatureType.Abstract:
This map of the benthic communities of the Western Channel off the north coasts of Brittany, in the region of Roscoff , is picked up from the thesis of Louis Cabioch (1968, Roscoff Biological Station) : "Contribution la connaissance des peuplements benthiques de la Manche occidentale", published in 1968 in the "Cahiers de biologie marine, tome IX, cahier 5 supll.".
Two maps representing the distribution of the benthic communities and the tiers were in particular produced in the document cited above : a map (scale = 1:180000) entitled "Rpartition gnrale des peuplements benthiques prlittoraux" and a map (scale = 1:50 000) (figure 45) entitled "Rpartition des peuplements benthiques dans la rgion de Roscoff" which is that described here.
This map was digitized in 2003, as part of the REBENT programme, i.e. the surveying network for the benthic fauna and flora.
The harmonization with the EUNIS typology was made in 2006, as part of the REBENT and Interreg-MESH programmes.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr000008
FeatureType.Title: [FR000008] Peuplements benthiques du golfe Nomano-breton (1979) au 1/152000
FeatureType.Abstract:
This map of the benthic communities of the normano-breton Gulf is picked up from the thesis of Christian Rtire, entitled "Contribution la connaissance des peuplements benthiques du golfe normanno-breton", published in 1979.
This map was digitized in 2003, as part of the REBENT programme, i.e. the surveying network for the benthic fauna and flora. The original legend is transferred to the "ORIG_HAB" attribute data fied.
The harmonization with the EUNIS typology was made in 2006, as part of the REBENT and Interreg-MESH programmes.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr000025
FeatureType.Title: [FR000025] Cartographie des habitats benthiques du secteur des Glnan (REBENT, 2006)
FeatureType.Abstract:
This comprehensive map of the benthic communities of Les Glnan is realized as part of the REBENT programme, i.e. the surveying network for the benthic fauna and flora. It is the result of the treatment, the analysis and the data aggregation from authors and multiple specialized agencies : - ORTHOLITTORALE 2000, - IFREMER, Lidar altimetry in 2005, - M. Le Hir, S. Chauvaud, G. Robert, from the engineering firm " Tldtection et Biologie Marine " (TBM) in 2005, - N. Alloncle, student at the Brest University in 2005, - CEVA in 2004 and 2005, - Bathymetric data from SHOM, - Rebent intertidal and subtidal field studies data collected between 2003 and 2006.
For these studies, various methods were used : coastal orthophotography, altimetric data from LIDAR, acoustic techniques, benthic sampling techniques, intertidal surveys.
The habitat typology held for the cartography is the EUNIS classification, the European reference (October, 2004 version).
In the rocky sectors, groupings of EUNIS classes were realized when the EUNIS typology was difficult to apply. It allows describing more easily the various environments.
The original legend is transferred to the "ORIG_HAB" attribute data field.
The harmonization with the EUNIS typology was made in 2006, as part of the REBENT and Interreg-MESH programmes.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr000035
FeatureType.Title: [FR000035] Carte des peuplements benthiques du secteur Vilaine (source : Ehrhold A., Blanchet A., Hamon D., 2008) - Echelle : 1/ 2000 1/10000
FeatureType.Abstract:
Cette carte des peuplements benthiques de la zone subtidale du secteur Vilaine est le rsultat du traitement, de l'analyse et de l'agrgation de donnes de : - A. Ehrhold, A. Blanchet, D. Hamon de l'Ifremer (2004 2008). - Donnes bathymtriques du SHOM.
Deux sources croises d'acquisition des donnes ont t employes : un systme acoustique embarqu (sonar balayage latral), permettant de dfinir des premires classes de signatures acoustiques, correspondant des units morpho-sdimentaires, compltes par des campagnes de prlvements la benne (chantillons sdimentaires biologiques).
La typologie des habitats a t labore par les auteurs suivants : D. Hamon, A. Blanchet, A. Ehrhold.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr000036
FeatureType.Title: [FR000036] Carte des peuplements benthiques subtidaux de la baie de Douarnenez (Source Blanchet A., Hamon D. et al., 2005) - Echelle 1/25000
FeatureType.Abstract:
La carte numrique des peuplements benthiques de la zone subtidale du secteur Douarnenez a t publie en 2005 dans l'Atlas thmatique de l'environnement marin de la baie de Douarnenez (Partenariat Ifremer et ville de Douarnenez, Ed. Ifremer, Coordination Augris C.).
Diffrentes mthodes ont t employes : mthodes acoustiques (sonar balayage latral, sondeur multifaisceaux), prlvements d'chantillons (benne Hamon), observations sous-marines (vido). La typologie des habitats a t labore par les auteurs suivants : D. Hamon, A. Blanchet, C. Chevalier (Ifremer/Dyneco/Benthos).

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr000037
FeatureType.Title: [FR000037] Carte des peuplements benthiques du secteur de Concarneau (Source A. Ehrhold, A. Blanchet, D. Hamon, 2007) - Echelle : 1/2 000 1/10 000
FeatureType.Abstract:
Cette carte des habitats benthiques de la zone subtidale du secteur de Concarneau est le rsultat du traitement, de l'analyse et de l'agrgation de donnes de : - A. Ehrhold, A. Blanchet, D. Hamon de l'Ifremer en 2003, 2005 et 2006, - donnes bathymtriques du SHOM.
Diffrentes techniques d'imageries ont t employes : systmes acoustiques embarqus et vido sous-marine. Les donnes ont t compltes par des campagnes de prlvements la benne. La typologie des habitats a t labore par les auteurs suivants : D. Hamon, A. Blanchet, A. Ehrhold.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr000040
FeatureType.Title: [FR000040] Carte des peuplements benthiques de la cte landaise au large d'Arcachon (Source Monbet Y., 1972) - Echelle : 1 / 300 000
FeatureType.Abstract: Cette carte des peuplements benthiques du secteur d'Arcachon a t ralise daprs la thse d'Yves Monbet, intitule " Etude bionomique du plateau continental au large d'Arcachon (application de l'analyse factorielle) ", publie en 1972. Cette tude sur les fonds chalutables de la cte landaise et girondine au large dArcachon a permis didentifier 5 aires sdimentaires disposes paralllement la cte. Les peuplements benthiques sont rpartis en 2 grands ensembles, lensemble ctier compos de 3 peuplements et lensemble subctier de 4 peuplements. La carte a t numrise en 2005 et une harmonisation avec la typologie EUNIS a t effectue en 2007 (projet REBENT).

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr000041
FeatureType.Title: [FR000041] Carte des peuplements de la partie franaise de la Mer du Nord (Source Davoult D., Dewarumez J.-M., Prygiel J., Richard A., 1988) au 1/149000
FeatureType.Abstract: Cette carte numrique est reproduite d'aprs la carte papier au 1/149000, ralise par Davoult D., Dewarumez J.M., Prygiel J. et Richard A. et publie en 1988 par la Station Marine de Wimereux, avec le concours de l'Ifremer et de la Rgion Nord-Pas de Calais. Cette carte a fait l'objet en 2006 d'une numrisation dans le cadre du rseau de surveillance de la flore et de la faune benthique marine REBENT.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr000043
FeatureType.Title: [FR000043] Carte biosdimentaire des fonds meubles des Pertuis charentais (Source Hily C., 1976) - Echelle 1 / 100 000
FeatureType.Abstract: Cette carte est la synthse de cartes extraites de la thse de Christian Hily sur les "Pertuis Charentais" publie en 1976 et de la carte de Claude Chass intitule "Pertuis et les Charentais - Carte bio-sdimentaire (Prvision)" de 1974, (avec pour la partie ouest, l'intgration des travaux gomorphologiques de J.P. Barusseau, D. Dorel et M. Tesson et des travaux de biologie de F. Lagardre (vasire de Gironde)). Une harmonisation avec la typologie EUNIS a t ralise en 2008, avec lexpertise de lauteur (projets Rebent et Interreg-MESH).

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr000046
FeatureType.Title: [FR000046] Atlas des fonds meubles du plateau continental du golfe de Gascogne : cartes biosdimentaires (Source Chass C., Glmarec M., 1976) - Echelle 1 / 100 000 1 / 500 000
FeatureType.Abstract:
Cette carte est la synthse des cartes de l'atlas de Claude Chass et Michel Glmarec de l'Universit de Bretagne Occidentale, "Atlas du littoral franais, atlas des fonds meubles du plateau continental du Golfe de Gascogne, cartes biosdimentaires", publi en 1976 avec le concours du CNEXO. Cet atlas comprend deux types de cartes : cinq cartes biosdimentaires ctires au 1/100000 et une carte plus gnrale au 1/500000.
Ces cartes ont fait l'objet en 2003 d'une numrisation dans le cadre du Rseau de surveillance de la flore et de la faune benthique marine REBENT. Sous forme numrique, ces cartes ont t regroupes en un seul lot de donnes.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr000048
FeatureType.Title: [FR000048] Carte des peuplements macrobenthiques en Manche orientale (Source Cabioch L., Gentil F., Glaon R., Retire C., 1978) - Echelle 1 / 100 000 1 / 200 000
FeatureType.Abstract:
Cette carte des peuplements macrobenthiques en Manche orientale est reproduite d'aprs la carte, ralise par Louis Cabioch, Franck Gentil, Ren Glaon et Christian Rtire de l'Observatoire Ocanologique de Roscoff, communique lors du colloque de l'UOF, les 26 et 27 janvier 1978 Brest. La carte originale n'a jamais t publie. C'est une communication directe des auteurs.
Pour cette tude, des chantillonnages ont t raliss entre 1971 et 1975.
Cette carte a fait l'objet en 2006 d'une numrisation dans le cadre du Rseau de surveillance de la flore et de la faune benthique marine REBENT.
Une harmonisation avec la typologie EUNIS a t ralise en 2007, dans le cadre des projets REBENT et Interreg-MESH.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr000051
FeatureType.Title: [FR000051] Carte des peuplements benthiques des substrats meubles de la baie de Saint-Brieuc (Source Thouzeau G., Hamon D., 1992) - Echelle 1/100000
FeatureType.Abstract: Cette cartographie numrique des peuplements benthiques des substrats meubles de la baie de Saint-Brieuc a t ralise en 2010, d'aprs la carte au 1/50000 tablie par Grard Thouzeau de l'Universit de Bretagne Occidentale et Dominique Hamon d'Ifremer centre de Brest et publie en 1992. Une harmonisation avec la typologie EUNIS a t ralise en 2011 par Dominique Hamon. Les documents l'origine de ce jeu de donnes sont le rsultat de travaux de recherche issus des programmes EUPHORBE et PNDR Coquille Saint-Jacques.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr000055
FeatureType.Title: [FR000055] Carte des habitats benthiques du secteur Quiberon (source : Ehrhold A., Hamon D. et al., 2010) - Echelle : 1/2000 1/10000
FeatureType.Abstract:
Cette carte des peuplements benthiques du secteur Quiberon est le rsultat du traitement, de l'analyse et de l'agrgation de donnes de : - campagnes REBENT 1 et 2 (2003) ; - campagne IMPACT 8 (2002).
Deux sources croises d'acquisition des donnes ont t employes : un systme acoustique embarqu (sondeur multifaisceaux) et remorqu (sonar balayage latral), permettant de dfinir des premires classes de signatures acoustiques, correspondant des units morpho-sdimentaires, compltes par des campagnes de prlvements la benne (chantillons sdimentaires biologiques), des profils vido et des plonges.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr000056
FeatureType.Title: [FR000056] Carte des peuplements benthiques de la Mer dIroise (Raffin C., 2003) - Echelle : 1 / 20 000 1 / 50 000
FeatureType.Abstract: Cette carte des peuplements benthiques de la Mer dIroise est reproduite d'aprs la carte ralise par Raffin C. en 2003 pour sa thse "Bases biologiques et cologiques de la conservation du milieu marin en mer d'Iroise". Cette carte a fait l'objet en 2007 d'une numrisation dans le cadre du rseau de surveillance de la flore et de la faune benthique marine REBENT. La lgende d'origine est reporte dans le champ attributaire LEG_ORIG. Une harmonisation avec la typologie EUNIS a t ralise en 2011. La mthode utilise inclut une re-dtermination individuelle des polygones, avec intervention d'experts scientifiques. Christian Hily (IUEM/LEMAR) a valid cette harmonisation en mai 2011.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr000058
FeatureType.Title: [FR000058] Carte des habitats benthiques subtidaux du secteur MORLAIX (Source Ehrhold A., Hamon D. et al., 2011) - Echelle 1 / 2 000 1 / 10 000
FeatureType.Abstract: Cette carte des peuplements benthiques subtidaux du secteur Morlaix est le rsultat du traitement, de l'analyse et de l'agrgation des donnes de campagnes REBENT entre 2008 et 2010. Deux sources croises d'acquisition des donnes ont t employes : un systme acoustique embarqu (sondeur multifaisceaux) et remorqu (sonar balayage latral), permettant de dfinir des premires classes de signatures acoustiques, correspondant des units morpho-sdimentaires, compltes par des campagnes de prlvements la benne (chantillons sdimentaires biologiques) et des profils vido.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr000059
FeatureType.Title: [FR000059] Carte des habitats benthiques subtidaux du secteur TREGOR-GOELO (Source Ehrhold A. et al., 2013)
FeatureType.Abstract: Cette carte des peuplements benthiques subtidaux du secteur Trgor-Golo est le rsultat du traitement, de l'analyse et de l'agrgation des donnes des campagnes REBENT 10 et 11 (2006), HALIOTREGOR (2008) et IFR-NEOMYSIS (2011). Deux sources croises d'acquisition des donnes ont t employes : un systme acoustique embarqu (sondeur multifaisceaux) et remorqu (sonar balayage latral), permettant de dfinir des premires classes de signatures acoustiques, correspondant des units morpho-sdimentaires, compltes par des campagnes de prlvements la benne (chantillons sdimentaires biologiques) et des profils vido.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr000060
FeatureType.Title: [FR000060] Carte de nature des fonds du site Natura 2000 en mer des Roches de Penmarc'h
FeatureType.Abstract: La carte de nature des fonds du site Natura 2000 en mer des Roches de Penmarc'h a t ralise dans le cadre du programme Interreg MeshAtlantic et constitue la premire tape de l'laboration de la carte des habitats subtidaux du site. Ce jeu de donnes provient de l'interprtation et l'interpolation des acquisitions intertidales et subtidales ayant eu lieu sur le site de Penmarc'h entre 2011 et 2012. Ont particip l'laboration de ce produit : - Stevenn Lamarche (coord.), (Ifremer - Applications Gomatiques) - Jacques Populus (Ifremer - Applications Gomatiques) - Anthony Dor (MNHN SPN - Station de Biologie Marine de Concarneau) - Fabrice Pluquet (HOCER) - Anouar Hamdi (Gomaticien) - Eliot Besson (Stagiaire)

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr002000
FeatureType.Title: [FR002000] Carte des habitats de la cte basque franaise - DOMAINE D'ABBADIA ET CORNICHE BASQUE - FR7200775
FeatureType.Abstract: FR7200775 - DOMAINE D'ABBADIA ET CORNICHE BASQUE Produit issu du programme MESH ATLANTIC. Ralis par l'IMA. Habitats : intertidaux. EUNIS 2007 Numrisation des habitats d'aprs les donnes existantes et une prospection terrain sur l'estran.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr002001
FeatureType.Title: [FR002001] Carte des habitats de la cte basque franaise - FALAISE DE SAINT-JEAN-DE-LUZ A BIARRITZ - FR7200776
FeatureType.Abstract: FR7200776 - FALAISE DE SAINT-JEAN-DE-LUZ A BIARRITZ. Produit issu du programme MESH ATLANTIC. Ralis par l'IMA. Habitats : intertidaux. EUNIS 2007 Numrisation des habitats d'aprs les donnes existantes et une prospection terrain sur l'estran.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr002002
FeatureType.Title: [FR002002] Carte des habitats de la cte basque franaise - COTE BASQUE ROCHEUSE ET SON EXTENSION AU LARGE - FR7200813
FeatureType.Abstract: FR7200813 - COTE BASQUE ROCHEUSE ET SON EXTENSION AU LARGE. Produit issu du programme MESH ATLANTIC. Ralis par l'IMA. Habitats : intertidal, infralittoral, circalittoral. EUNIS 2007 Numrisation des habitats d'aprs les donnes existantes, donnes Vecteurs, polygones des habitats. Synthse bibliographique, prospection terrain (multibeam)

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr003001
FeatureType.Title: [FR003001] Trgor-Golo habitat map
FeatureType.Abstract: This subtidal map was made in the framework of the Cartham project from 2009-2012. It incorporates remote sensing data in the form of a few side scan sonar profiles, along with a reasonable amount of sediment and fauna samples. Large gaps within the acoustic coverage were filled by the interpreter using evidence from bathymetric data, before the resulting polygons were labelled according to the biology contained in them. The habitat classification was a synthesis of the main habitat classifications, namely:Generic habitats from the Habitat Directive (EUR 27), elementary habitats from the French Cahiers dhabitats, the Rebent classification and EUNIS level 4 as much as possible.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr003002
FeatureType.Title: [FR003002] Coastal benthic habitat map of Natura 2000 site "Cte de Trestel Paimpol", estuaires du Trieux et du Jaudy et archipel de Brhat
FeatureType.Abstract: This map covers both the intertidal zone and subtidal zones of the study sites. It is made from high resolution remote sensing data - both acoustic and optical - from various surveys carried out over the period 2008 to 2013 of various types: (i) multibeam echosounder (MBES), side scan sonar (SSS), RoxAnn acoustic ground discrimination system (AGDS), (ii) ortho-photography (the Ortholittorale survey from 2000), (iii) topographic and bathymetric lidar . It was complemented by (i) underwater video,(ii) sediment and biological grab samples, (iii) ground truth data from surveys in the tidal and infralittoral zone using GPS, annotations and photography.The habitat classification was a synthesis of the main habitat classifications, namely:Generic habitats from the Habitat Directive (EUR 27), Elementary habitats from the French Cahiers dhabitats, The Rebent classificationand EUNIS level 4 as much as possible. Map scale is in the range of 1:20000, with local improvements to 1:10000.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr003003
FeatureType.Title: [FR003003] Trgor-Golo habitat map - Rebent_2
FeatureType.Abstract: This map mostly results from the interpolation in gaps between surrounding maps. In places the rugosity derived from bathymetric data (soundings from hydrographic minutes and hydrographic lidar) enabled the interpreter to infer rocky seabed presence. In shallowest places aerial photography was also used to retrieve rocky seabed, distinguished from similar-looking Zostera beds owing to a historic Zostera bed inventory available to the project. The habitat classification was a synthesis of the main habitat classifications, namely: Generic habitats from the Habitat Directive (EUR 27), Elementary habitats from the French Cahiers dhabitats, The Rebent classificationand EUNIS level 4 as much as possible.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr003004
FeatureType.Title: [FR003004] Morlaix habitat map - Carthem programme
FeatureType.Abstract: This subtidal map was made in the framework of the Cartham project from 2009-2012. It incorporates remote sensing data in the form of a few side scan sonar profiles, along with a reasonable amount of sediment and fauna samples. Large gaps within the acoustic coverage were filled by the interpreter using evidence from bathymetric data from the 100m DTM for the shelf of France as well as the 1:500000 scale sediment map for the Channel pulished by Larsonneur. Homogenous polygons were then labelled according to the biology contained in them.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr003005
FeatureType.Title: [FR003005] Morlaix habitat map - Rebent intertidal
FeatureType.Abstract: This map covers the intertidal zone of Baie de Morlaix.The main data source was aerial photography (known as Ortholittorale 2000) which was photo-interpreted at a detailed scale to provide homogeneous ground units. Groundtruthingwas obtained from field observation and accurate positioning pprovided by RTK-GPS. Groundtruthsampledatawere also collected from which grain size was visually determined. Benthos was sorted out in the lab and each sample was assigned a habitat label. The habitat classification is EUNIS 2007.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr003006
FeatureType.Title: [FR003006] Morlaix habitat map - Rebent subtidal
FeatureType.Abstract: This map covers the inshore subtidal zone of the Baie de Morlaix. Several surveys surveys were carried out between 2008-2013: (i) optical remote sensing with bathymetric lidar (operated by Bloom Ltd.) and aerial photography (Ortholittorale 2000) in very shallow water, (ii) acoustic tools such as multibeam echosounder, side scan sonar and Roxann acoustic ground detection system. Ground truth data was obtained with underwater video, sediment and fauna grab samples interpreted in the lab for particle size analysis and benthos identification. The habitat classification is EUNIS 2007. Map scale is around 1:20000, with local improvements to1:10000

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr003007
FeatureType.Title: [FR003007] Roches de Penmarc'h
FeatureType.Abstract: Mapis based on the interpretation of various types of data from a number of surveys carried out between 2011-2012 both in the intertidal and subtidal zones. Additionally the seabed Carte G from the French hydrographic survey (SHOM) was used in the interpretation process. In the tidal zone the identification was made by interpreting coastal ortho-photographs from BD Ortho (2005 et 2009) and digitising them on scale 1 : 2000me with further qualification of the polygons based on ground truth data. For the subtidal zone, several data sources from 2011 were available: bathymetric lidar (with sounding density about 1pt*3m-2), side scan sonar (resolution of about 0.2m), underwater video, sediment and fauna samples collected with grabs and trawls. Addtionnally a single beam sounder was running at all times during the transects, which contributing to improve the depth DTM. In the outer rocky circalittoral zone, side scan sonar corridors were surveyed with a coverage of 30-50% depending on places. In the offshore deep circalittoral zone (known as La Grande vasire) where soft sediment is predominant, side scan sonar coverage was reduced to about 5-10%. In these latter two circalittoral zones, interpolation between sonar corridors was supported by SHOM Carte G (approx. scale 1:100000) along with a 100m resolution depth DTM. On rocky seabed, exposure at the seabed was described using kinetic energy from a combination of wave and current hydrodynamic models according to the methods described in: http://doi.org/10.13155/49975. Rocky substrate in intertidal and infralittoral zones was derived from the combined interpretation of both the topographic and bathymetric Lidar DTMs and aerial photographs, where permitted by water transparency. Various representations of the DTMs (slope, hillshade) helped delineate rocky outcrops with good reliability. Biological qualification of the substrate polygons was made through taxonomic analysis of benthos samples collected by MNHN in the framework of the project"Ecological assessment of Natura 2000 site - Roches de Penmarch".The final habitat classification was a synthesis of the main habitat classifications, namely: Generic habitats from the Habitat Directive (EUR 27), Elementary habitats from the French Cahiers dhabitats, The Rebent classificationand EUNIS level 4 as much as possible.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr003008
FeatureType.Title: [FR003008] Habitats marins du site Natura 2000 - Plateau du Four
FeatureType.Abstract: L'objectif de cette production est la caractrisation cartographique des habitats marins des sites Natura 2000 relevant de l'application de la directive europenne Habitats-Faune-Flore (66 sites Natura 2000 entirement marins) ainsi que de quatre parcs naturels marins et projets de parcs naturels marins.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr003009
FeatureType.Title: [FR003009] Habitats marins du site Natura 2000 - Rochebonne
FeatureType.Abstract: L'objectif de cette production est la caractrisation cartographique des habitats marins des sites Natura 2000 relevant de l'application de la directive europenne Habitats-Faune-Flore (66 sites Natura 2000 entirement marins) ainsi que de quatre parcs naturels marins et projets de parcs naturels marins.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr003010
FeatureType.Title: [FR003010] Ile de Groix habitat map
FeatureType.Abstract: The objective of this production is the cartographic characterization of the marine habitats of the Natura 2000 sites coming under the European Habitats-Fauna-Flora (66 Natura 2000 all-marine sites) and four marine natural parks and parks projects. marine life.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr003011
FeatureType.Title: [FR003011] Habitats marins du site Natura 2000 - Plateau rocheux de l'Ile d'Yeu
FeatureType.Abstract: L'objectif de cette production est la caractrisation cartographique des habitats marins des sites Natura 2000 relevant de l'application de la directive europenne Habitats-Faune-Flore (66 sites Natura 2000 entirement marins) ainsi que de quatre parcs naturels marins et projets de parcs naturels marins.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr003012
FeatureType.Title: [FR003012] Habitats marins du site Natura 2000 - Dunes et Ctes de Trvignon
FeatureType.Abstract: L'objectif de cette production est la caractrisation cartographique des habitats marins des sites Natura 2000 relevant de l'application de la directive europenne Habitats-Faune-Flore (66 sites Natura 2000 entirement marins) ainsi que de quatre parcs naturels marins et projets de parcs naturels marins.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr003013
FeatureType.Title: [FR003013] Seabed Habitat (EUNIS) - Lot 06 'Pertuis Charentais et Estuaire de la Gironde' (Cartham) - FR003013
FeatureType.Abstract: Seabed habitat map (EUNIS classification system) performed by CREOCEAN, LIENSs, EPOC, GEOTRANSFERT, RE NATURE ENVIRONNEMENT & IODDE within the framework of CARTHAM ("cartographie des habitats marins") project coordinated by the French Biodiversity Agency (Agence franaise pour la biodiversit, AFB). FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr004012
FeatureType.Title: [FR004012] Seabed Habitat (EUNIS) - FR5300017 "Abers - Cte des lgendes" (Compilation of maps) - FR004012
FeatureType.Abstract: Mapping of the Natura 2000 site FR5300017 "Abers - Cte des lgendes" was jointly performed in the framework of three different actions: (i) the Natura 2000 convention for Brittany, and (iii) CARTHAM Project. It is based on the interpretation of various types of data from a number of surveys carried out between 2005-2012 both in the intertidal and subtidal zones. Additionally the seabed Carte G from the French hydrographic survey (SHOM) was used in the interpretation process. In the tidal zone the identification was made by interpreting coastal ortho-photographs from BD Ortho (2005 et 2009) and digitising them on scale 1 : 2000me with further qualification of the polygons based on ground truth data. A confidence score in the [0-100] scale has been assigned to each polygon (SUM_CONF field) The compilation comprises the following various data sources. Lamarche S., Bajjouk T., 2013. Cartographie des habitats benthiques intertidaux du site Natura 2000 FR 5300017 - Abers - Ctes des lgendes - Parties estuariennes. Rf. RST - DYNECO/AG/13-05/TB. Rollet C., Bonnot-Courtois Ch., Hamon N. et Loarer R., 2010. Carte des habitats benthiques intertidaux du secteur des Abers - Zone intertidale (multisource Rebent,) - Echelle : 1/10 000 ErHold et al., (2012, unpublished). Cartographie de natures des fonds subtidaux du secteur des Abers - Ctes des lgendes. TBM, 2012. Inventaire cartographique des habitats marins du site Natura 2000 Abers Ctes des Lgendes FR5300017. Rapport CRTHAM, 104 p.

FeatureType.Abstract: Mapping of the Natura 2000 site FR5300017 "Abers - Cte des lgendes" was jointly performed in the framework of three different actions: (i) the Natura 2000 convention for Brittany, and (iii) CARTHAM Project. It is based on the interpretation of various types of data from a number of surveys carried out between 2005-2012 both in the intertidal and subtidal zones. Additionally the seabed Carte G from the French hydrographic survey (SHOM) was used in the interpretation process. In the tidal zone the identification was made by interpreting coastal ortho-photographs from BD Ortho (2005 et 2009) and digitising them on scale 1 : 2000me with further qualification of the polygons based on ground truth data. The compilation comprises the following various data sources. Lamarche S., Bajjouk T., 2013. Cartographie des habitats benthiques intertidaux du site Natura 2000 FR 5300017 - Abers - Ctes des lgendes - Parties estuariennes. Rf. RST - DYNECO/AG/13-05/TB. Rollet C., Bonnot-Courtois Ch., Hamon N. et Loarer R., 2010. Carte des habitats benthiques intertidaux du secteur des Abers - Zone intertidale (multisource Rebent,) - Echelle : 1/10 000 ErHold et al., (2012, unpublished). Cartographie de natures des fonds subtidaux du secteur des Abers - Ctes des lgendes. TBM, 2012. Inventaire cartographique des habitats marins du site Natura 2000 Abers Ctes des Lgendes FR5300017. Rapport CRTHAM, 104 p.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr004031
FeatureType.Title: [FR004031] Seabed Habitat (Habitat Directive) - FR5302008 'Roches de Penmarch' - FR004031
FeatureType.Abstract: Mapping of the Natura 2000 site Roches de Penmarc'h was jointly performed in the framework of two different actions: (i) the Natura 2000 convention for Brittany and (ii) the Interreg Area MeshAtlantic Project. It is based on the interpretation of various types of data from a number of surveys carried out between 2011-2012 both in the intertidal and subtidal zones. Additionally the seabed Carte G from the French hydrographic survey (SHOM) was used in the interpretation process. In the tidal zone the identification was made by interpreting coastal ortho-photographs from BD Ortho (2005 et 2009) and digitising them on scale 1 : 2000me with further qualification of the polygons based on ground truth data. For the subtidal zone, several data sources from 2011 were available: bathymetric lidar (with sounding density about 1pt*3m-2), single beam sounder on sonar and video transects, side scan sonar (resolution of about 0.2m), underwater video, grab sediment and fauna samples. In the outer rocky circalittoral zone, side scan sonar corridors were surveyed with a coverage of 30-50% depending on places. In the offshore circalittoral zone (known as La Grande vasire) where soft sediment is predominant, side scan sonar coverage was reduced to about 5-10%. In these latter two circalittoral zones, interpolation between sonar corridors was supported by SHOM Carte G (approx. scale 1 : 100 000) along with a 100m resolution depth DTM. On rocky seabed, exposure at the seabed was described using kinetic energy from a combination of wave and current hydrodynamic models according to the methods described in: http://doi.org/10.13155/49975 Rocky substrate in intertidal and infralittoral zones was derived from the combined interpretation of both the topographic and bathymetric Lidar DTMs and aerial photographs, where permitted by water transparency. Various representations of the DTMs (slope, hillshade) helped delineate rocky outcrops with good reliability. Biological qualification of the substrate polygons was made through taxonomic analysis of benthos samples collected by MNHN in the framework of the project Ecological assessment of Natura 2000 site Roches de Penmarch .

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:fr004032
FeatureType.Title: [FR004032] Seabed Habitat (Habitat Directive) - FR5300015 'Baie de Morlaix' - FR004032
FeatureType.Abstract: The habitat map of the the Natura 2000 site Baie de Morlaix is a composite of five different habitat map layers that were merged together and harmonised. The five original maps were made according to various mapping strategies, using different sets of tools and interpretation methods, at different scales. Several coverage tools were used for the subtidal and tidal zones: bathymetric lidar from 2008, aerial photography (Ortholittorale 2000), acoustic tools such as multibeam echosounder, side scan sonar and Roxann acoustic ground detection system. Ground truth was obtained with underwater video, sediment and fauna grab samples and visual identification by foot using GPS. Field surveys were conducted between 2008-2013. Gaps were filled either by interpolation or extrapolation when feasible with the help of depth data from soundings or satellite imagery in shallow waters.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000039
FeatureType.Title: [GB000039] Benthic Biodiversity in the Southern Irish Sea 2: South-West Irish Sea Survey (SWISS)
FeatureType.Abstract: The South-West Irish Sea Survey (SWISS) was initiated in 1996 as a collaborative venture between Irish and Welsh scientists under the European Union INTERREG II programme. Its primary aims were to evaluate the biodiversity of the south-western Irish Sea/Celtic Sea area, chart the benthic invertebrate assemblages, identify areas of importance for future more applied studies, compare selected sites over time, and examine the relative performance of differing sampling techniques.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000227
FeatureType.Title: [GB000227] Broad scale biological mapping of Lundy Marine Nature Reserve with particular reference to reefs.
FeatureType.Abstract: A survey of habitats, including particular reference to the reefs around Lundy Island, Bristol Channel, undertaken by the Benthic Mapping and Assessment Project (BMAP) at the University of Newcastle. This dataset is a map of the predicted lifeform distribution based on the acoustic characteristics of the seabed.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000228
FeatureType.Title: [GB000228] St John's Lake intertidal biotope map (Tamar estuary, Plymouth)
FeatureType.Abstract: This dataset is a biotope map of the intertidal zone of St John's Lake, Plymouth Sound. This map was produced as a result of a broad scale mapping survey of Plymouth Sound carried out in July 1996. A data review was also carried out in this study. Mapping was carried out using acoustic techniques, validated by dive and remote survey. Predictive maps of biotopes were prepared with GIS.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000229
FeatureType.Title: [GB000229] Plymouth Sound and Estuaries substrate map
FeatureType.Abstract: This dataset is a broadscale biotope map of Plymouth Sound. This map was produced as a result of a broad scale mapping survey of Plymouth Sound carried out in July 1996. A data review was also carried out in this study. Mapping was carried out using acoustic techniques, validated by dive and remote survey. Predictive maps of biotopes were prepared with GIS.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000236
FeatureType.Title: [GB000236] ITE Wash Birds and Invertebrates report 1988
FeatureType.Abstract: Two surveys of the sediments and macro-invertebrates of intertidal areas of the Wash were undertaken during late September to early November 1998 and 1999. In 1998, 113 sites, each 1 ha in area were sampled, 91 of which were sampled in Institute of Terrestrial Ecology's survey of 1986. In 1999, 103 sites were sampled, 82 of which had been first sampled in 1986.

FeatureType.Title: [GB000258] Broad scale habitat mapping of intertidal and subtidal coastal areas, Loch Maddy - lifeforms in the outer, central and inner areas
FeatureType.Abstract: This dataset is a predicted lifeform distribution map for the outer, central and inner areas of Loch Maddy

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000259
FeatureType.Title: [GB000259] Broad scale habitat mapping of intertidal and subtidal coastal areas, Loch Maddy - lifeforms in the inner area
FeatureType.Abstract: This dataset is a predicted lifeform distribution map for part of the inner area of Loch Maddy

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000263
FeatureType.Title: [GB000263] Broadscale survey and mapping of seabed and shore habitats and biota, Dornoch Firth pSAC - biotopes
FeatureType.Abstract: The aim of this survey was to map the biotopes in the area of Dornoch Firth between Bonar Bridge and a line extending from Dornoch to the mid-point of the intertidal rocks west of Portmahomack. This dataset is a map of the predicted biotope distributions for this area.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000267
FeatureType.Title: [GB000267] Broadscale survey and mapping of the shore habitats and biota, Firth of Lorn, Western Scotland - prevailing littoral lifeforms
FeatureType.Abstract: Phase I survey of the littoral zone of the Firth of Lorn. This dataset is a map detailing prevailing lifeforms. Each polygon is associated with a series of lifeforms encountered during the survey down the shore. Transects were divided into four parts and thus the attribute contains four lifeforms.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000268
FeatureType.Title: [GB000268] Broadscale survey and mapping of the seabed and shore habitats and biota: St Kilda cSAC: subtidal lifeforms
FeatureType.Abstract: A map of predicted subtidal lifeforms around St Kilda including Hirta, Dun, Levenish, Soay and Boreray

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000272
FeatureType.Title: [GB000272] Broadscale survey and mapping of seabed and shore habitats and biota, Lochs Duich, Alsh and Long.
FeatureType.Abstract: A map of the distribution and extent of marine littoral and sublittoral biotopes within Lochs Duich, Long and Alsh, on the north west coast of Scotland. Shore surveys were carried out to record the biotopes occurring within the survey area. Sublittoral acoustic surveys were carried out within the lochs, with ground validation of acoustic data by video sampling, and grab sampling of sediments for infaunal and particle size analysis. The electronic GIS shapefile only maps sublittoral biotopes. Biotopes mapped during shore surveys are not available in electronic format.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000273
FeatureType.Title: [GB000273] Broad scale survey and mapping of seabed and shore habitats and biota, Papa Stour Shetland.
FeatureType.Abstract: A survey of habitats and biota within the Papa Stour cSAC

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000277
FeatureType.Title: [GB000277] Broad scale survey and mapping of the seabed and shore habitats and biota: Vadills cSAC Shetland - shore types
FeatureType.Abstract: A map of the shore types within the Vadills cSAC

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000278
FeatureType.Title: [GB000278] Broadscale intertidal survey, Loch Laxford cSAC, 2001.
FeatureType.Abstract: Broadscale intertidal survey of Loch Laxford cSAC, biotope mapping.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000279
FeatureType.Title: [GB000279] Firth of Forth intertidal biotope map
FeatureType.Abstract: Broadscale intertidal survey of the Firth of Forth, biotope mapping.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000281
FeatureType.Title: [GB000281] MNCR Area Summaries - South-east Scotland and north-east England
FeatureType.Abstract: The coast from North Berwick in Lothian to Flamborough Head in the East Riding of Yorkshire has been studied as part of the Marine Nature Conservation Review programme (MNCR Sector 5). This included field surveys of the shores and nearshore subtidal zone to describe biotopes. Comparable data from other organisations have been added to provide information on over 1000 sites within the region and analysed to classify the biotopes present. The information available for MNCR Sector 5 is presented as 24 area summaries.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000282
FeatureType.Title: [GB000282] MNCR Area Summaries - Inlets in eastern England
FeatureType.Abstract: A series of twelve marine inlets on the East Anglian and north Kent coasts (MNCR sector 6) have been studied as part of the Marine Nature Conservation Review programme. Comparable data from other organisations have been added to provide information on over 460 sites within the twelve inlets and analysed to classify the biotopes present.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000283
FeatureType.Title: [GB000283] MNCR Area Summaries - Inlets in the western English Channel
FeatureType.Abstract: The coast from Durlston Head in Dorset to Cape Cornwall has been studied as part of the Marine Nature Conservation Review programme (MNCR Sector 8). Sixteen marine inlets occur along this stretch of coast and have been the subject of various surveys to describe the biotopes. An analysis of the available data from these inlets has been undertaken as part of the Marine Nature Conservation Review.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000284
FeatureType.Title: [GB000284] MNCR Area Summaries - Inlets in the Bristol Channel and approaches
FeatureType.Abstract: The habitats and communities of the marine inlets of south-west Britain have been the subject of various surveys, primarily the Harbours, Rias and Estuaries (HRE) programme commissioned by the then Nature Conservancy Council. The HRE surveys were carried out by the Field Studies Council Oil Pollution Research Unit (OPRU) between 1985 and 1989 and covered all of the major and most of the minor inlets between Portsmouth and Milford Haven. The report summarises information on fourteen marine inlets, from the River Hayle in Cornwall northwards to Milford Haven in Pembrokeshire. The data from the HRE surveys, together with data from a variety of other sources, have been analysed to classify the marine biotopes present and to describe their distribution within each inlet.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000285
FeatureType.Title: [GB000285] MNCR Area Summaries - Cardigan Bay and north Wales; scar
FeatureType.Abstract: In 1995 the Marine Nature Conservation Review (MNCR) initiated a survey of Cardigan Bay and north Wales (MNCR Sector 10). Field surveys undertaken between 1995 and 1997 covered 23 sections of the coast within Sector 10. This included field surveys of the shores and nearshore subtidal zone to describe the biotopes. Comparable data from other organisations have been added to provide information on over 700 sites within the region and analysed to classify the biotopes present.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000286
FeatureType.Title: [GB000286] MNCR Area Summaries - Liverpool Bay and the Solway Firth; Wigtown and Kirkcudbright Bays
FeatureType.Abstract: The coast from Colwyn Bay in north Wales to the Mull of Galloway in south-west Scotland (MNCR Sector 11) has been studied as part of the Marine Nature Conservation Review programme. This included field surveys of the shores and nearshore subtidal zone to describe the biotopes. Comparable data from other organisations have been added to provide information on over 320 sites within the region and analysed to classify the biotopes present. The information available for MNCR Sector 11 is presented as 12 area summaries.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000287
FeatureType.Title: [GB000287] MNCR Area Summaries - Sealochs in the Clyde Sea
FeatureType.Abstract: The sealochs of the Clyde Sea (MNCR Sector 12) have been studied as part of the Marine Nature Conservation Review programme. This included field surveys of the shores and nearshore subtidal zone to describe the biotopes. Comparable data from other organisations have been added to provide information on over 250 sites within the region and analysed to classify the biotopes present. The information available for MNCR Sector 12 is presented as 7 area summaries.

FeatureType.Abstract: The sealochs of the Outer Hebrides (MNCR Sector 14) have been studied as part of the Marine Nature Conservation Review programme. This included field surveys of the shores and nearshore subtidal zone to describe the biotopes. Comparable data from other organisations have been added to provide information on over 400 sites within the region and analysed to classify the biotopes present. The information available for MNCR Sector 14 is presented as 26 area summaries.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000291
FeatureType.Title: [GB000291] MNCR Area Summaries - Lagoons in Shetland and Orkney
FeatureType.Abstract: In 1993, the MNCR initiated a survey of lagoons in Scotland. Eighteen lagoons in MNCR Sector 1, the Shetland Islands, were surveyed in August 1993 and sixteen lagoons were surveyed in July 1994 in MNCR Sector 2, the Orkney Islands. This included field surveys of the shores and nearshore subtidal zone to describe the biotopes. Comparable data from other organisations have been added and the data analysed to classify the biotopes present. The information available for MNCR Sectors 1 & 2 is presented as 34 area summaries.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000292
FeatureType.Title: [GB000292] MNCR Area Summaries - Lagoons in the Outer Hebrides
FeatureType.Abstract: In 1993, the MNCR initiated a survey of lagoons in Scotland. Seventy-two lagoons in the Outer Hebrides were studied as part of this programme. This included field surveys of the shores (if tidal) and subtidal zone of each lagoon to describe the biotopes. Comparable data from other organisations have been added and the data analysed to classify the biotopes present. The information available for MNCR Sector 14 is presented as 72 area summaries.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000293
FeatureType.Title: [GB000293] MNCR Area Summaries - Lagoons in mainland Scotland and the Inner Hebrides
FeatureType.Abstract: In 1993, the MNCR initiated a survey of lagoons in Scotland. Thirty-three lagoons in mainland Scotland and the Inner Hebrides were studied as part of this programme, with field studies undertaken in 1994 and 1995.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000333
FeatureType.Title: [GB000333] Morecambe Bay map of Zostera beds
FeatureType.Abstract: This map shows the area covered by seagrass beds in the west part of Morecambe Bay, near Walney Island. The data were obtained by the MESH Project as the results of a data collation contract undertaken by OSPAR.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000334
FeatureType.Title: [GB000334] Roosecote sands and east of Walney Island map of Zostera beds
FeatureType.Abstract: This map shows the area covered by seagrass beds to the east of Walney Island and in Roosecote Sands (both areas are west of Morecambe Bay). The data were obtained by the MESH Project as the results of a data collation contract undertaken by OSPAR.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000335
FeatureType.Title: [GB000335] Devon and Dorset map of Zostera beds
FeatureType.Abstract: Past and present datasets containing details of Zostera beds in Devon and Dorset have been merged into one dataset

FeatureType.Abstract: null

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000356
FeatureType.Title: [GB000356] Broadscale survey and mapping of seabed biota in Loch Creran, Argyll
FeatureType.Abstract: A broadscale benthic survey of Loch Creran was carried out in 1998-1999. The primary objective of the study was to map the sublittoral habitats and delimit biotopes. AGDS was used, ground-truthed by grab sampling, ROV, diver video and stills photography.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000357
FeatureType.Title: [GB000357] Broadscale mapping of habitats in the Firth of Tay and Eden Estuary, Scotland
FeatureType.Abstract: A biotope mapping survey of the intertidal and subtidal habitats within the Firth of Tay and Eden Estuary cSAC was undertaken in the summer of 2002, by a collaborative research group from the University of St Andrews, Heriot-Watt University, Edinburgh University and Scottish Natural Heritage (SNH). Mapping of the intertidal area of the cSAC was accomplished principally through the employment of satellite imagery. This imagery was ground truthed by data from intertidal surveys. This information supplemented the existing knowledge on the distribution of marine communities and sediments within the cSAC and all this information was used to produce a series of biotope classification maps.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000358
FeatureType.Title: [GB000358] Broadscale mapping of sublittoral habitats in Loch Sunart, Scotland
FeatureType.Abstract: Loch Sunart is a complex fjordic sea loch on the west coast of Scotland. The loch supports some of the best Scottish and UK examples of bedrock reef habitats and associated communities. The site has been selected as a candidate Special Area of Conservation (cSAC) on the basis of the quality of the reefs present. A biotope mapping survey of the sublittoral habitats within the loch was undertaken in July and August 2001, by a collaborative research group from the University of St Andrews, Heriot-Watt University and Scottish Natural Heritage (SNH). Rapid broad scale remote acoustic mapping techniques were utilised and ground truth data were collected to enable the interpretation of the acoustically-classed seabed maps. These data supplemented the considerable body of existing knowledge on Loch Sunart marine communities and this information was depicted in a series of biotope distribution maps.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000359
FeatureType.Title: [GB000359] Broadscale mapping of sublittoral habitats in the Sound of Barra: south east of South Uist
FeatureType.Abstract: This map covers the area in the north of The Sound of Barra, at the south-eastern end of South Uist. The Sound of Barrahas been selected as a possible Special Area of Conservation (pSAC) on the basis of the nationally important colony of common seals, Phoca vitulina, and also for the wide variety of habitats associated with shallow ?sandbanks which are slightly covered by seawater all the time?. A number of the sandbank habitats are of considerable conservation value, most notably the extensive beds of the eelgrass Zostera marina and tide-swept maerl beds composed of the coralline red alga Phymatolithon calcareum. A comprehensive biotope mapping survey of the sublittoral habitats within the Sound was undertaken in August 2001, by a collaborative research group from the University of St Andrews, Heriot-Watt University, Edinburgh University and Scottish Natural Heritage (SNH). This information supplemented the existing knowledge on the distribution of marine communities within the Sound of Barra pSAC and all this information was synthesised into a series of biotope classification maps.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000360
FeatureType.Title: [GB000360] Broadscale mapping of sublittoral habitats in the Sound of Barra: north east of Barra
FeatureType.Abstract: This map covers the area in the south of The Sound of Barra, at the northeastern corner of Barra (from Traigh Mhor to near Loch Obe). The Sound of Barra has been selected as a possible Special Area of Conservation (pSAC) on the basis of the nationally important colony of common seals, Phoca vitulina, and also for the wide variety of habitats associated with shallow ?sandbanks which are slightly covered by seawater all the time?. A number of the sandbank habitats are of considerable conservation value, most notably the extensive beds of the eelgrass Zostera marina and tide-swept maerl beds composed of the coralline red alga Phymatolithon calcareum. A comprehensive biotope mapping survey of the sublittoral habitats within the Sound was undertaken in August 2001, by a collaborative research group from the University of St Andrews, Heriot-Watt University, Edinburgh University and Scottish Natural Heritage (SNH). This information supplemented the existing knowledge on the distribution of marine communities within the Sound of Barra pSAC and all this information was synthesised into a series of biotope classification maps.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000361
FeatureType.Title: [GB000361] Broad Scale Mapping of Mousa cSAC: intertidal biotopes
FeatureType.Abstract: This dataset is a biotope map of the intertidal area around Mousa, Shetland. The survey visited the island of Mousa cSAC in August and September 2003 with the aim of providing a comprehensive broad scale intertidal and subtidal biotope distribution map of Mousa cSAC. Particular emphasis was placed upon the mapping and recording of the reef and cave communities present on the island.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000363
FeatureType.Title: [GB000363] Broad Scale Mapping of Mousa cSAC: subtidal lifeforms
FeatureType.Abstract: This dataset is a subtidal lifeforms map for the area around Mousa, Shetland. The survey visited the island of Mousa cSAC in August and September 2003 with the aim of providing a comprehensive broad scale intertidal and subtidal biotope distribution map of Mousa cSAC. Particular emphasis was placed upon the mapping and recording of the reef and cave communities present on the island.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000364
FeatureType.Title: [GB000364] Broad Scale Biotope Mapping of the Isle of May cSAC: intertidal biotopes
FeatureType.Abstract: As part of the Forth Spatial Study the intertidal and subtidal areas of the Isle of May cSAC, and a surrounding 1km wide buffer zone were surveyed to provide a comprehensive broad scale biotope distribution map of the area. This dataset is an intertidal biotope map of the island.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000365
FeatureType.Title: [GB000365] Broad Scale Biotope Mapping of the Isle of May cSAC: subtidal lifeforms
FeatureType.Abstract: As part of the Forth Spatial Study the intertidal and subtidal areas of the Isle of May cSAC, and a surrounding 1km wide buffer zone were surveyed to provide a comprehensive broad scale biotope distribution map of the area. This dataset is a subtidal lifeforms map of the 1km buffer zone around the island.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000367
FeatureType.Title: [GB000367] Biotope Mapping and Survey of the Treshnish Isles Candidate Special Area of Conservation (cSAC) - subtidal biotopes
FeatureType.Abstract: Survey of the intertidal and subtidal zones of the Treshnish Isles cSAC to provide a broad scale biotope distribution map for the area. This dataset is a map of predicted subtidal lifeforms for the area surrounding the Treshnish Isles.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000369
FeatureType.Title: [GB000369] Biotope Mapping and Survey of the Treshnish Isles Candidate Special Area of Conservation (cSAC) - intertidal biotopes
FeatureType.Abstract: Survey of the intertidal and subtidal zones of the Treshnish Isles cSAC to provide a broad scale biotope distribution map for the area. This dataset is a map of intertidal biotopes on the Treshnish Isles.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000371
FeatureType.Title: [GB000371] Mapping of the benthic biotopes in the proposed Sound of Arisaig Special Area of Conservation
FeatureType.Abstract: SNH commissioned the BioMar project to map the distribution of biotopes and lifeforms in the Sound of Arisaig pSAC, and in addition, undertake further detailed studies of the maerl beds within the site. Video and grab samples were collected, and 12 sites surveyed in detail by diving to collect samples for maerl analysis and characterisation of the biotopes associated with the maerl. 23 biotopes were identified from the video samples and by the MNCR sealochs survey. A map of the predicted biotope distribution based on the acoustic characteristics of the sea bed was prepared for the survey area.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000372
FeatureType.Title: [GB000372] MNCR Area Summaries - Inlets in eastern England
FeatureType.Abstract: A series of twelve marine inlets on the East Anglian and north Kent coasts (MNCR sector 6) have been studied as part of the Marine Nature Conservation Review programme. Comparable data from other organisations have been added to provide information on over 460 sites within the twelve inlets and analysed to classify the biotopes present.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000374
FeatureType.Title: [GB000374] MNCR Area Summaries - Sealochs in the Clyde Sea
FeatureType.Abstract: The sealochs of the Clyde Sea (MNCR Sector 12) have been studied as part of the Marine Nature Conservation Review programme. The studies included field surveys of the shores and nearshore subtidal zone to describe the biotopes. Comparable data from other organisations have been added to provide information on over 250 sites within the region and analysed to classify the biotopes present. The information available for MNCR Sector 12 is presented as 7 area summaries.

FeatureType.Title: [GB000375] MNCR Area Summaries - Sealochs in west Scotland
FeatureType.Abstract: Unpublished

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000376
FeatureType.Title: [GB000376] MNCR Area Summaries - Lagoons in the Outer Hebrides
FeatureType.Abstract: In 1993, the MNCR initiated a survey of lagoons in Scotland. Seventy-two lagoons in the Outer Hebrides were studied as part of this programme. The studies included field surveys of the shores (if tidal) and subtidal zone of each lagoon to describe the biotopes. Comparable data from other organisations have been added and the data analysed to classify the biotopes present. The information available for MNCR Sector 14 is presented as 72 area summaries.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000377
FeatureType.Title: [GB000377] MNCR Area Summaries - Lagoons in mainland Scotland and the Inner Hebrides - Part 2
FeatureType.Abstract: In 1993, the MNCR initiated a survey of lagoons in Scotland. Thirty-three lagoons in mainland Scotland and the Inner Hebrides were studied as part of this programme, with field studies undertaken in 1994 and 1995.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000423
FeatureType.Title: [GB000423] Broadscale mapping of sublittoral habitats in the Sound of Barra: south west of South Uist
FeatureType.Abstract: This map covers the area in the north of The Sound of Barra, at the south-western end of South Uist.The Sound of Barra has been selected as a possible Special Area of Conservation (pSAC) on the basis of the nationally important colony of common seals, Phoca vitulina, and also for the wide variety of habitats associated with shallow ?sandbanks which are slightly covered by seawater all the time?. A number of the sandbank habitats are of considerable conservation value, most notably the extensive beds of the eelgrass Zostera marina and tide-swept maerl beds composed of the coralline red alga Phymatolithon calcareum. A comprehensive biotope mapping survey of the sublittoral habitats within the Sound was undertaken in August 2001, by a collaborative research group from the University of St Andrews, Heriot-Watt University, Edinburgh University and Scottish Natural Heritage (SNH). This information supplemented the existing knowledge on the distribution of marine communities within the Sound of Barra pSAC and all this information was synthesised into a series of biotope classification maps.

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000443
FeatureType.Title: [GB000443] West Hebrides Biotope Mapping Project
FeatureType.Abstract: This project attempts to map the broadscale biotopes and habitats of the rocky reef sites west of the Outer Hebrides through integrating multibeam echosounder data, acoustic ground discrimination system (AGDS) data, underwater video/camera surveys and grab data, facilitated through the use of GIS. Where possible, biotopes have been resolved and classified using the National Marine Habitat Classification for Britain and Ireland (Connor et al., 2004).

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000470
FeatureType.Title: [GB000470] Isle of Man sandbank
FeatureType.Abstract: Opportunistic survey of the sandbank in offshore waters east of the Isle of Man as part of JNCC offshore Natura 2000 site assessment processes. Grab sampling, AGDS, side scan sonar and video data were obtained on 3 separate cruises. Data was worked up by AFBI and QUB as part of an MoA between JNCC and AFBI/DARD (NI).

FeatureType.Name: emodnet_open_maplibrary:gb000471
FeatureType.Title: [GB000471] Eastern Channel Broadscale Habitat Mapping Project: Aggregate Levy Sustainability Fund (ALSF)
FeatureType.Abstract:
This aim of the project was to provide integrated broadscale habitat maps for an extensive area within the central part of the Eastern English Channel in order to support the sustainable management of offshore resources.
The maps integrated geological, geophysical and biological data and interpretations, including new surveys using high resolution geophysical systems, ground truthed with sampling and video.
The immediate driver was the discovery of substantial aggregate resources in this area and the requirement to manage the sustainable development of this resource and minimise potential impacts.
